title: Rocket Launch Emissions Oracle on Cardano
summary: In 2024, 261 rocket launches generated ~50,000 tons of CO₂. No standardized, independently verified measurement system exists. Launch providers calculate emissions using inconsistent methodologies.
solution: We will build an oracle for verifiable rocket emissions data certified offsets and ESG reporting. Enabling launch providers to unlock non-dilutive green financing and new revenue from anonymized data.

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
**                           The Fundamental Innovation: **

**               World's First Space Industry Carbon Oracle.**

**=> No comparable system exists**. While carbon accounting infrastructure exists for aviation, shipping, and ground transportation, the space industry has been operating without standardized, independently verified emissions measurement. We offer the first blockchain oracle specifically designed for rocket launch emissions, a completely greenfield application.

**=> The data shows** 261 orbital launches in 2024 generated approximately 50,000 tons of CO₂, yet every launch provider calculates emissions differently.

**=> Significant increase from previous years**, with the Satellite Industry Association (SIA) reporting that 2024 saw a historic number of launches and a record 2,172 tons of material sent into Earth orbit. The previous year, 2023, had 223 orbital launches, and 2022 had 186 but there is little available on the emmissions generated by these rocket launches.

**=> There is no 'ICAO for space'** (International Civil Aviation Organization sets aviation standards) so we're not improving an existing system, we’re building the foundational infrastructure from scratch right here on Cardano.

**Innovation \#1:** Industrial IoT Oracle on Cardano (Technical First).

- Cardano's first space industry oracle bringing real world sensor data on-chain at scale.
- Existing Cardano oracles (Charli3, Orcfax): Focus on financial data feeds. They pull data from APIs and centralized sources

**=> How we differ:**

- Physical IoT sensors at industrial sites (launch pads)
- Real time telemetry during high stakes operations (rocket launches)
- Integration with proprietary industrial systems (launch computers, fuel management)
- Zero knowledge proofs to protect commercial IP while proving data validity

**=> Why Cardano:**

- We leverage eUTXO's deterministic nature for industrial compliance data (critical for ESG audits).
- Plutus formal verification for smart contracts handling green finance
- Prototype Hydra for high-throughput sensor data

Demonstrating Cardano's viability beyond DeFi and Gaming use cases.

**=> No other blockchain** has proven industrial IoT oracle capability at this scale for this industry.  We know because we have checked and spoken to them recently at DevConnect in Argentina.

**Innovation \#2**: Zero-Knowledge Privacy for Commercial Space Operations.

**The Problem**

- Launch providers won't share telemetry data publicly.
- Fuel consumption profiles, thrust curves, and trajectory data reveal competitive advantages
- Manual audits require sharing this data with third party auditors, creating IP leakage risk.

**Our Solution**

- ZK-SNARK proofs allow us to prove "Launch X emitted Y tons CO₂" **without revealing the underlying telemetry\.**
- What goes on-chain (public): "387.4 tons CO₂e"
- What stays private: Exact fuel mass, burn time, thrust profile, payload distribution.

This is the first application of zero knowledge proofs to industrial emissions accounting.

**Innovation \#3**: Automated Offset Certification Pipeline.

**Our Process:**

1. Launch happens → IoT sensors capture data in real time
2. Oracle feeds emissions to Cardano in minutes not weeks
3. Smart contract records emissions on-chain (immutable)
4. Company purchases offsets from a certified provider
5. Smart contract verifies offset retirement certificates (on-chain proof)
6. When emissions + offsets match → Carbon neutral certificate auto minted
7. ESG report generator pulls on-chain data → Produces 40-page report (30 days vs. 6 months sta dard pipeline).

**Innovation \#4:** Emissions Data-as-a-Service Marketplace

What doesn't exist today: A market for verified space industry emissions data.

Who needs this data:

- Space insurers for risk modelling
- ESG rating agencies have an industry data gap
- Satellite operators need Scope 3 data as best as possible
- Academic researchers need emissions baselines

**Our innovation: **A Decentralized data marketplace on Cardano where:

- Launch providers control their data via anonymized sharing
- Data buyers pay in ADA for access (micropayments via smart contracts)
- Revenue split automated (70% launch provider, 30% Company)
- IPFS storage + on-chain access control (pay → receive decryption key)

**Precedent**: Ocean Protocol and Streamr have built decentralized data marketplaces, but not for industrial compliance data, not for space, and not with this revenue-sharing model where the data originators (launch providers) get paid.

**Our point of difference**: We're not just selling data, we're creating a new asset class (verified space emissions information) and a new revenue stream for launch providers who monetize their compliance data.

**Innovation \#5**: Green Finance Infrastructure for Space Industry.

**The gap: **Launch providers are locked out of $2B+ in green financing because they lack the verified emissions data ESG capital requires. Green bonds, sustainability linked loans and climate tech grants all demand credible carbon accounting, which doesn't really exist for space.

**We unlock:**

- Sustainability linked loans
- ESG capital
- Climate grants

**Innovation:** We believe this is the first time blockchain infrastructure has been purpose built to unlock green finance for an entire industry. We're building the data infrastructure that makes green finance possible for space.

**Innovation \#6**: Academic Grade Methodology with UN Framework Heritage.

**=> Our approach: **

- Built on Dr. Makane Faye's UN adopted framework for sectoral digital strategies (UNECA, 20+ years developing e-government, e-agriculture, ICT measurement methodologies globally). [https://archive\.uneca\.org/sites/default/files/PublicationFiles/workingpapers\_idep\_makane\.pdf](https://archive.uneca.org/sites/default/files/PublicationFiles/workingpapers_idep_makane.pdf)
- Universidad Nacional de La Plata (UNLP) is available to certify our methodology; one of the first academic institutions to validate space emissions accounting: [https://suti\.ing\.unlp\.edu\.ar/verificacion\-creditos\-de\-carbono/](https://suti.ing.unlp.edu.ar/verificacion-creditos-de-carbono/)
- Our methodology is being published, will be peer reviewable and replicable and not proprietary black box.



**Innovation: **We're bringing academic rigor to an industry that's been winging it. We are not a startup claiming "trust our algorithm" we are implementing an education and compliance backed, framework based methodology with 20 years of UN digital infrastructure precedent.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Our prototype will demonstrate a complete end to end **Rocket Launch Emissions Oracle on the Cardano testnet**.



It will ingest sample launch telemetry, calculate CO₂ emissions using a standardized methodology generate a verifiable data package (including optional ZK proof), and publish the results to a Plutus smart contract.

Users will be able to view launch emissions directly from the blockchain, showing how Cardano can serve as a trusted, transparent registry for industrial emissions data.

The prototype will validate the full workflow:

1. Data ingestion from real or simulated rocket telemetry
2. Emissions calculation engine producing CO₂ tonnage
3. Oracle service posting results to Cardano testnet
4. On-chain storage of emissions records and data hashes
5. Optional ZKproved methodology check to demonstrate privacy preserving verification



This proves that Cardano can securely anchor high value industrial data, enabling future integrations with certified offsets, ESG reporting tools, and green financing mechanisms.



Accessible here: [https://github\.com/Astropsy/Compliance\_Smart\_Meter](https://github.com/Astropsy/Compliance_Smart_Meter)



Sample UI here: [https://drive\.google\.com/file/d/1HXfTwLh6Fz5eiwSmgTHOFNmaLlWs57Bk/view?usp=drive\_link](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1HXfTwLh6Fz5eiwSmgTHOFNmaLlWs57Bk/view?usp=drive_link)

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Success will be measured by the delivery and usage of a **fully functional emissions oracle on the Cardano testnet\.** 



**=\> Key indicators include**



- Number of successful oracle updates posted on-chain (target: 50+ emissions data submissions during testing).
- Unique launch datasets processed (target: at least 5 distinct datasets from simulated or partner provided telemetry).
- Number of smart contract reads/queries from the UI dashboard (target: 100+ interactions during community testing).
- Accuracy validation using our academic methodology benchmark (target: 90-95%+ conformity to expected outputs).
- Zero knowledge proof verification success (target: at least one working ZK proof validating methodology integrity).
- Community testers engaged via open testnet demo (target: 50+ unique testers).

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
**Our Solution: Build the Cardano Rocket Emmissions Oracle\.**



- Built on Dr. Makane Faye's UN adopted framework for sectoral digital strategies (UNECA, 20+ years developing e-government, e-agriculture, ICT measurement methodologies globally). [https://archive\.uneca\.org/sites/default/files/PublicationFiles/workingpapers\_idep\_makane\.pdf](https://archive.uneca.org/sites/default/files/PublicationFiles/workingpapers_idep_makane.pdf)
- Universidad Nacional de La Plata (UNLP) is available to certify our methodology; one of the first academic institutions to validate space emissions accounting [https://suti\.ing\.unlp\.edu\.ar/verificacion\-creditos\-de\-carbono/](https://suti.ing.unlp.edu.ar/verificacion-creditos-de-carbono/)
- Use of ZK-SNARK proofs allows us to prove Launch X emitted Y tons CO₂ without revealing the underlying telemetry.
- What goes on-chain (public): 387.4 tons CO₂
- What stays private: Exact fuel mass, burn time, thrust profile, payload distribution.
- This is the first application of zero knowledge proofs to industrial emissions accounting.



**Our Process:**

1. Launch happens → IoT sensors capture data in real time
2. Oracle feeds emissions to Cardano in minutes not weeks
3. Smart contract records emissions on-chain (immutable)
4. Company purchases offsets from a certified provider
5. Smart contract verifies offset retirement certificates (on-chain proof)
6. When emissions + offsets match → Carbon neutral certificate auto minted
7. ESG report generator pulls on-chain data → Produces 40-page report (30 days vs. 6 months sta dard pipeline).



**Our Innovation:**

=> End to end automation with blockchain provenance. Traditional offset markets are entirely manual (PDFs, emails, registries that don't talk to each other).

=> We're building the first automated verification pipeline from measurement → offset verification → certification → ESG reporting.

=> This unlocks Green Financing initiatives for our clients

=> Gives them a way to monetize high value, niche datasets while retaining full privacy

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
**What This Means for Cardano**

This project expands Cardano’s technical capabilities by delivering a new class of oracle: one that anchors high value industrial data, not only price feeds directly onto the blockchain.

By open sourcing the full pipeline (ingestion, calculation, oracle service, smart contracts, and ZK verification), we provide reusable infrastructure that other builders, researchers, and enterprises can adopt for their own real world data applications thereby exposing Cardano to thousands of users as can be seen in our AI Training Dataset use case example that has been viewed and downloaded by thousands of people:

[https://www\.kaggle\.com/datasets/lifebricksglobal/llm\-rag\-chatbot\-training\-dataset](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/lifebricksglobal/llm-rag-chatbot-training-dataset)



Our system and infrastructure demonstrate  Cardano's viability for:

- Industrial IoT applications (beyond financial speculation)
- Real-world data oracles (beyond price feeds)
- ESG compliance infrastructure (enterprise use case)
- Sustainability linked finance (green bonds, climate capital)
- Revenue generating B2B applications



The prototype will drive** measurable on\-chain activity** through **recurring oracle updates**, contract interactions, and community testing. 



It also strengthens Cardano’s position in the **RWA and enterprise sectors** by demonstrating a practical, verifiable way to **bridge real world emissions data onto the chain**. 



This creates new opportunities for developers to build compliance tools, ESG applications, green financing protocols and other **smart contract utilities** on top of the data we provide.



This is Cardano's entry into the $500B+ space economy. Not through speculation or meme coins, but through **mission critical infrastructure** that launch providers, insurers, and green finance institutions will depend on.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
Our team combines direct industry partnerships, academic validation, and verifiable technical experience across smart contracts, oracle systems, and emissions modelling.

==> We have an established collaboration with UNLP’s environmental engineering department, who validate the emissions methodology

==> A confirmed launch partner providing real telemetry datasets under NDA.

This ensures our calculations and data pipeline are grounded in real world aerospace operations rather than theoretical models.

On the technical side:

We have experienced developers with public GitHub histories in blockchain architecture

an NZ-registered entity to manage delivery, contracting, and accountability.

We have already completed foundational research, data ingestion prototypes, system diagrams, and marketplace/oracle components in existing repositories, demonstrating readiness to execute.



We have the structural research backing of a United Nations diplomat Mr Makane F.:

[https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/makane\-faye\-6b410b84/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/makane-faye-6b410b84/)

We have an internationally recognised lawyer registered in 3 jurisdictions:

[https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/patricia\-espindola\-99599393/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/patricia-espindola-99599393/)



We have a highly capable in-house technical lead:

John Okyere

[https://github\.com/mhiskall282](https://github.com/mhiskall282)

[https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/johnokyere/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/johnokyere/)



Supported by our CEO and Head of Product

Tom Faye

[https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/tomfayepublic/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/tomfayepublic/)

[https://github\.com/lifebricksglobal](https://github.com/lifebricksglobal)

[https://www\.kaggle\.com/lifebricksglobal](https://www.kaggle.com/lifebricksglobal)



Retired aeronautical engineer on call as required for confirmation of data points.

Alberto M.



**Feasibility will be validated through a working prototype deployed on Cardano testnet:**

- Successful ingestion of sample launch telemetry
- accurate emissions computation
- oracle updates visible on-chain
- community verifiable outputs via a user facing dashboard.

**Each milestone includes measurable, auditable checkpoints:**

- GitHub commits
- Testnet contract addresses
- Oracle update logs
- ZK proof demonstrations

Ensuring transparent accountability throughout the project.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
- A functioning project repository exists with a clear structure and initial documentation.
- Sample rocket dataset can be ingested and normalized into a consistent JSON format.
- Core architecture and data flow diagrams accurately describe the planned oracle system.
- A placeholder Plutus contract is deployed and visible on Cardano testnet.
- The basic infrastructure for data storage and processing (e.g., AWS table schemas) is in place.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
- Public GitHub repository with initial commits, folder structure, and documentation
- Uploaded architecture diagrams (oracle pipeline, emissions flow, smart contract schema)
- Basic data ingestion + cleaning script (CSV → normalized JSON) committed
- AWS (or equivalent) data table schema screenshot for ingestion testing
- Placeholder Plutus contract deployed to Cardano testnet
- Link and screenshot of testnet contract address on an explorer
- Loom video walkthrough demonstrating repo setup, ingestion test, and contract stub

sub_fields.answer: Emissions Engine & Smart Contract Functionality

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
**Deliverables:**



- Full emissions calculation engine implemented on AWS and integrated with Aiken smart contracts.
- Data hashing + verification logic completed
- Smart contract updated to store emissions records
- End to end local test

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
- The emissions calculation engine produces accurate CO₂ output using validated methodology.
- The hashing + verification logic correctly generates deterministic digests for processed datasets.
- The smart contract can store emissions records in the expected format.
- End to end local workflow (ingestion → calculation → contract write) executes without errors.
- At least one full sample dataset is processed and written to the testnet contract.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
To verify Milestone 2, we will provide public, timestamped, and independently verifiable artifacts, including:



**1\. GitHub Commits**



- Public commits implementing the emissions calculation engine
- Code for hashing + verification logic
- Updated smart contract code with state changes for emissions storage
- Tagged release for Milestone 2
- Updated README and technical documentation describing the calculation workflow



**2\. Testnet Contract Interactions**



- Cardano testnet transaction hashes showing successful writes to the smart contract
- Screenshot and link to the testnet explorer confirming emissions records stored on-chain



**3\. Data Processing Evidence**

- Screenshot or export of processed sample telemetry through the emissions engine
- Logs from local end-to-end test: ingestion → calculation → contract write
- Cloud infrastructure screenshot (e.g., AWS Lambda/S3/DynamoDB) showing dataset processed and cleaned



**4\. Video Demonstration**



Loom walkthrough demonstrating the emissions engine running, generating outputs, and writing to the testnet contract

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
This project delivers strong value for the Cardano ecosystem by creating a high impact oracle that anchors real, industrial grade data on-chain, something no other blockchain currently offers. For a modest budget, we are building infrastructure that connects Cardano to the rapidly expanding global space industry, where both emissions transparency and ESG accountability are becoming regulatory requirements.



The cost is focused on technical execution, with the majority allocated to development and the two founders who will deliver the core oracle, ZK verification prototype, emissions engine, and testnet deployment. In return, Cardano gains a reusable open-source oracle framework, a high visibility real world use case, and an opportunity to differentiate itself as a chain capable of handling trusted industrial data rather than speculative assets alone.



This represents excellent value for money: a relatively small investment yields outsized exposure, demonstrates Cardano’s utility to an entirely new sector, and positions the ecosystem as a credible platform for enterprise class RWA, ESG, and DePIN integrations.
